titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Time Inc. Annex Files
1854, 1909, 1923-2014
MS 3009-RG 39
titlestmt.author: Allen Thomas and Samantha Brown
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:50:46 -0400.

did.unittitle: Time Inc. Annex Files

physdesc.extent: in 192 record cartons, 5 flat boxes, and 34 oversized boxes

did.abstract: The Time Inc. Annex Files is an assembled collection created by the archivists at Time Inc. of materials considered too bulky or infrequently requested to be housed in the main archives. Records in the Annex Files seem to be an extension of the of the materials in the Time Inc. Subject Files (MS 3009-RG 1) and document the history of Time Inc. as an organization with information on each publication and many departments at Time Inc. The collection is largely made up of records pertaining to the development of magazines, The March of Time, Home Box Office (HBO), Time-Life Books, and information on public affairs programs and events, international business, and advertising studies and surveys.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The materials are primarily in English with very rare occurrences of several other languages.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials may include contracts and consent forms. Restricted materials are located in boxes R40, R41, and R69-R85. Unreformatted audiovisual and digital material in the collection is not accessible. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically based on the original arrangement.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Time Inc. Annex Files were assembled by the archivists at Time Inc. from materials considered too bulky or infrequently requested to be housed in the main archives. The archivists moved these records from the Time Inc. Archives' Library to a lower floor within the Time Inc. building to save space. The materials were housed in the building's sub-basement prior to the 2015 donation donated to the New-York Historical Society in 2015.
Citation: Hooper, Bill. Email to Holly Deakyne, 2016 June 10.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Time Inc. Annex Files, MS 3009-RG 39, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Time Inc. Annex Files were partially processed by Samantha Brown in 2019 and 2020 and completed by Allen Thomas in 2020. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding or if no original folder was present. Thomas and Brown created the inventory and other descriptive notes for the record group. Materials were arranged in their original order unless no order was present then an order was imposed.
Holly Deakyne processed and added the materials in Box 4273 in 2021.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.
Due to the nature of this collection described in the Historial Note many of the other record groups in the Time Inc. Records contain related materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Time Inc. Annex Files seem to be an extension of the materials in the Time Inc. Subject Files (MS 3009-RG 1) documenting the history of Time Inc. as an organization and include information on each publication and many departments at Time Inc. The Subject Files were assembled for use by writers and researchers working on three authorized volumes of Time Inc. history, and the Annex Files were presumably not part of this project.

Departments and offices include but are not limited to: Time Inc.'s magazines such as Architectural Forum, Fortune, Life, People, Sports Illustrated, Time, and smaller titles; as well as Time-Life Books, Home Box Office (HBO), and Corporate Development; and The March of Time. Main topics include The March of Time newsreels and radio program; international business studies and agreements; marketing studies and surveys; records on public affairs programs and conferences; samples of non-Time Inc. publications for study, and "war task" information and propaganda material produced by Time Inc. in cooperation with the United States government during the Second World War for both civilian and military consumption. Specific items of interest include the scripts from The March of Time radio program, newsreels, and movie specials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
